1.22.21  7:54 pm   When people say to me "your mixes sounds thin/muddy because of the arrangement", I kind of understand where they're coming from - frequencies clash, they can't occupy the same space etc etc. But is this what people really mean by "arrangement"? Because I feel like there's gotta be more to it. Can you shed light on this? What is a "bad" arrangement and what is a "good" arrangement?

1.22.21  5:22 pm   i have a billion undeveloped song ideas lying around and i really want to see them turn into real songs, but whenever i try to develop any of them further i almost always find myself paralyzed at the thought of making any "wrong" musical decisions, and not fulfilling the idea's true potential-not creating the strongest possible version of it, or accidentally not staying true to what the original idea was meant to convey, if that makes sense. i feel as though these ideas can be truly great but i'm not ready to write them yet. should i work on more non-serious ideas as practice to build up to the serious ones

     or should i just not take them as seriously or what?
1.22.21  5:21 pm   Does your visuals in videos have any correlation to the deeper meaning of the song?
